result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal M Endres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by 09-05-2019 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Credit for 24 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law within 1 year, upon submission of motion. EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTIGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.
Consecutive to: any sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal M Endres

records.addlTxt: Completion of Representation

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law within 1 year, upon submission of motion. EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTIGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 450.11(7)(h), an unclassified Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWENTY-FOUR (24) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWENTY-FOUR (24) DAYS served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 09-05-2019 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Defendant Crystal M Endres in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.

Attorney Barbara K Due for Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Matter before the Court for Revocation/Sentencing.  Defense requested any Warrant issued be STAYED.  State OBJECTED and requested a Warrant.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Crystal M Endres in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  
Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea hearing.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Hearing proceeds.

COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court STAYED entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
No reply from surety/defendant.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 16-07, parties are advised that effective August 1, 2016 this case is reassigned to Branch 11, Judge David Swanson, in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense advised that Defendant will be meeting with Judy B. from the OSPD regarding an assessment for medication.  Defense also advised that Defendant may need to work with Sojourner as well.  Court ordered Defendant to wait for Judy B. DIRECTLY following this hearing.  Court ADMONISHED DEFENDANT FOR THE POSITIVE TEST.  Matter remains calendared for Pre-Trial Conference 05-31-2016 at 08:30 am before Br. 44.
Court orders $50 of the bail forfeited.  Court orders the bail to remain the same.  Defendant to post another $50 cash TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.

State advises the Court the deferred prosecution agreement is rescinded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Crystal M Endres in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed; no alcohol.   

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
